climbs.name: With a Bullet
climbs.fa: Luke Bertelsen, Kemper Brightman, Tiffany Bertelsen - 2016

content.description:
After a ramp start follow an intermittent and chunky crack system to a crux right at the end of the route.   

  As you clip the chains look slightly left and see how this one got it's name.

This one is quite fun and well worth running a couple of laps on.  The climb starts out mellow as you make your way toward the looming person sized crack.   

  There is a little bit of a runout when compared to the more recently bolted routes as you are "Walking the Plank" and depending on your height you may have to do a dicey move to get to bolt 5 following the runout. 

  Crossing the crack and onto the pillar is definitely the crux.  This is followed by some longer pulls on good holds on your way to the anchors.  Really nice rock on this one.
content.location: The is currently the fourth bolted line (left to right) on The Draw Pile.  This climb is easily identifiable as it climbs across a giant crack and onto a pillar feature at it's midway point.

content.description: Be sure your belayer is watching you close at the first and second bolts. A harder than it looks sequence stemming and or laybacking up a wide crack leads to a lot of fun stuff above. A ton of loose is on either side of this thing so don't be wandering all over the wall.
content.location: Scramble up on to a ledge left of Morgan Freeman's Voice then follow bolts up and around the big tree.

content.description:
This one is for that must have trad fix in a land of bolted climbs.   

  Climb the alpine staircase to the base of the giant flake just above the hungry hackberry bush.  Do not fall into this bush - it does not play nice.  Your rope will attest to this later. 

  Climb the steep vertical flake with intermittent horizontal fractures.   

  Takes good gear the whole way.
content.protection: You can throw the kitchen sink at this thing.  If you want to climb slow you will find awesome nut placements.  This thing will also easily take #3-5 Camalots through most of the layback flake.
content.location: This is the crack right of 'Entertainment Tonight'.

content.description: Begin by climbing a steep right angling ramp.As the rock turns more vertical surmount the crux by wandering left or right rather than straight up around mid height. Â The bolts mirror the arete and even with the wandering nature the climber is never too far from the bolt line.Finish on awesome underlings and jugs as you make your way to the top of the formation.
content.location:
Left most route on "The Draw Pile" 

  Start from the parking pullout as for the other climbs.  When the path takes the first right turn continue straight uphill to the base of the cliff.

content.description:
Following a ramp start this one kicks back to dead vertical climbing on BIG holds.  This one is a hoot as you are always grabbing a jug and standing on huge feet. 

  The only downside is that it's over too soon.  All the more reason the get on it again.

A crux just below the midway point gives way to some small roof wrangling and a  giant "horn of plenty" just before the anchors. 

  Find the tiny seat above bolt 4, sit down, and wave to the folks driving down the mountain. 

  This climb may not be in the grade for long, but it's good fun all the same.
content.protection: 8 bolts to chains with lower offs.
content.location: Second route on The Draw Pile (left to right).

content.description:
Hard start and then eases to 5.6/7 pretty quickly - after bolt 2.   

  Climb a long ways up the slab with good holds and small ledges the entire way.
content.location: Currently the second route on The Draw Pile.  Just right of "Walking the Plank.

content.description:
Following a ramp start you will encounter three bolts of classic Mt. Lemmon edging.  Finish up with some easier arete climbing. 

  Although this climb is nowhere near as soothing as Morgan Freeman's voice it is fun.
content.protection:
8 bolts to chain anchors. 

Bolt 4 is high due to low quality rock below it for a lower bolt placement - the permadraw is there for community use.  Please do not steal this lest you prefer to be condemned to fail on your project for the next calendar year.
content.location: Continuing on the trail past Re-Gifting this is the next route you will come upon.  Identifiable as it climbs a short arete section at the very top.

content.description:
Following a ramps start this climb follows a broken crack system until it slabs out near the anchors. 

  With a longer vertical section than it's neighbor to the left, "Spontaneous Conga Line", and just as many giant holds this one is destined to see a lot of traffic.

This climb goes and goes.   

  Climb low angle rock with interesting moves that meander slightly left on "the Deck" and culminate with the use of an awesome undercling prior to the last bit of slab on your way to the chains.

Climb "Hindsight is 2020" but keep going for 30 more feet of climbing that takes you all the way to the top of Crags Against Humanity.

 Congratulations, you are the winner.

 Tie a knot at the end of your 60M rope.
content.location: This is the extension to "Hindsight is 2020"

content.description:
This route climbs some of the cleanest rock at Crags Against Humanity.   

  Ascend the alpine staircase to high first bolt, then strap on the nitro for some premium edging and problem solving.   

  This one is sure to be a crowd-pleaser.  Extra stars if people stop at the pullout and are overheard saying, "How do they get the rope up there?"
content.protection: 7 bolts to chains with lower offs.
content.location: Third route on The Draw Pile (left to right).

climbs.name: All My Hexes Live in Texas

content.description: All my hexes live in Texas And Texas is a place I'd dearly love to be But all my hexes live in Texas And that's why I bolted this route as you can see.Forget your hexes in Texas and bring your quickdraws for this new route at the draw pile! Begin in the corner just right of re-gifting and make your way to a jug-tastic crack above. Climb low-angle terrain to the top of the ledge where you'll want to strap on those climbing boots for a few moves of two-stepping action. Enjoy the ensuing romp, but keep those boots on, there's a bit more dancing before the night is done.
content.protection: 10 Quick Draws to Lower-off Anchor.    Please top-rope on your own gear!
content.location: This route is directly right of Re-gifting, or two routes right of the notable arete of Walking the plank.

content.description: This is the main wall at Crags Against Humanity. The formation faces north east and is clearly visible on the right hand side if you are traveling down mountain.
